Author: Decker#3767
Content:
https://github.com/DeckerSU/KomodoOcean/releases/tag/v2.0.15-rc2-g28-5 - `v2.0.15-rc2-g28-5`

**What's new?**

- createrawtransaction RPC enhancement (read `help createrawtransaction`)
- rebranding: new icons, logos and color schemes
- add support of some chains with max eras > 3
- add support of HUSH3 supply curve
- minor fixes

Author: David Jackson#9229
Content: Just a quick question about uninstalling KomodoOcean (have installed on another computer, now want to remove from my laptop). Is it just a simple matter of dragging all the files to the recycle bin? Or is there more to it than that? (I am on Linux, running Ubuntu). Thanks heaps.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content:
to remove komodo ocean
`rm -rf path_to/ocean_folder`
if you want to completely remove blockchain and other data as well
`rm -rf ~/.komodo` > this will remove every other assetchain data as well not recommended if you only want to delete KMD
to just remove KMD 
`rm -rf ~/.komodo/blocks`
`rm -rf ~/.komodo/chainstate`
`rm -rf ~/.komodo/wallet.dat`
`rm -rf ~/.komodo/notarisations`
`rm -rf ~/.komodo/komodostate`
basically everything from ./komodo folder

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: as From File explorer yes just delete them from the directories mentioned above

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: make sure you have a backup of wallet.dat / or private keys / seed

Author: gcharang#6833
Content: @David Jackson what Oszy said, but make sure to backup the wallet.dat
